title: Symbolic Manipulations - Exp/Log/Trig Functions Part A

content.description:
Directions:

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>f</mi> </math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>x</mi> </math> for which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaaguart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadAgacaGGOaGaamiEaiaacMcaaaa@3988@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a real number. Angle measures for trigonometric functions are assumed to be in radians.

Solutions to equations must be real numbers. Determine the exact value of any expression that can be obtained without a calculator. For example, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mi>log</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mtext> </mtext><mn>8</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C5E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mfrac> <mi>π</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CFC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D11@</annotation> </semantics> </math> can be evaluated without a calculator.

Unless otherwise specified, combine terms using algebraic methods and rules for exponents and logarithms, where applicable. For example, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaaikdacaWG4bGaey4kaSIaaG4maiaadIhaaaa@3A9E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mn>5</mn> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>⋅</mo><msup> <mn>5</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BEE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>5</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A32@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>ln</mi><mtext> </mtext><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>ln</mi><mtext> </mtext><mn>5</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F89@</annotation> </semantics> </math> should be rewritten in equivalent forms.

For each part of the question, show the work that leads to your answers.
content.question:
Part A

The functions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> are given by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>ln</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mi>ln</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@482E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mtext> </mtext><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4990@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.                                          

(i) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadEgacaaMi8UaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaaaaa@3B1B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> as a single natural logarithm without negative exponents in any part of the expression. Your result should be of the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>ln</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mtext>expression</mtext> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4324@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. 

(ii) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadIgacaaMi8UaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaaaaa@3B1C@</annotation> </semantics> </math> as an expression in which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiGacogacaGGVbGaai4CaiaaysW7caWG4baaaa@3BA6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> appears once and no other trigonometric functions are involved.

frqParts.text:
Part A

The functions <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>g</mi> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>h</mi> </math> are given by

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>ln</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mi>ln</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@482E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mtext> </mtext><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi><mtext> </mtext><mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4990@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.                                          

(i) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadEgacaaMi8UaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaaaaa@3B1B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> as a single natural logarithm without negative exponents in any part of the expression. Your result should be of the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>ln</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mtext>expression</mtext> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4324@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. 

(ii) Rewrite <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadIgacaaMi8UaaiikaiaadIhacaGGPaaaaa@3B1C@</annotation> </semantics> </math> as an expression in which <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>cos</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiGacogacaGGVbGaai4CaiaaysW7caWG4baaaa@3BA6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> appears once and no other trigonometric functions are involved.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
